description: From Middle English *bernis, *barnisch, from Old English *bearnisc and Old Norse bernskr (“childish”), from Proto-Germanic *barniskaz (“childish”), equivalent to bairn +‎ -ish. Cognate with Gothic 𐌱𐌰𐍂𐌽𐌹𐍃𐌺𐍃 (barnisks, “childish”).

adjectives.description: bairnish (comparative more bairnish, superlative most bairnish)

entries.meaning: (UK dialectal, Northern England, Scotland) Having the manners of a child; childish; silly.
